I feel like the game is a bit short, whished it was longer. But it is definitly a great game, many cool puzzles.

Portal is an amazing game which will make any puzzle loving gamer with lots of time and even more patients p*ss his/ her (not gonna be sexist or anything) out of pure joy. 

The game is hard, but only because it requires you to think outside the box. It also is quiet light on the PC, so even gamers with low-end machines (like me) will be able to run it.

I recomend Portal to anyone who loves to think.

Сразу хочу сказать, это одна из немногих игр, из тех, в которые я играл, с превосходной локализацией! [i]Если Вам необходима [b]качественная русская озвучка[/b] для полного погружения в атмосферу и Вам нравятся [b]головоломки[/b], Portal - то, что Вам нужно.[/i]
Отличная идея и, к тому же прекрасно реализованная, подарила нам [b]несколько дней интересного приключения и качественнейшего контента[/b].
Вы играете за девушку, которая принимает участие в тестах, проводимых некой компанией Aperture. В руки к Вам попадает портативное устройство для создания порталов и тут то всё и начинается...
Невероятно [b]увлекательный геймплей[/b] без чего бы то ни было лишнего, [b]атмосфера[/b], [b]развитие сюжета[/b] и [b]немного юмора[/b], всё это не даст Вам заскучать.
А пройдя основную игру, для большего вызова и азарта, при желании Вы можете попробовать [b]испытания[/b]. Некоторые из них не так просты и наверняка смогут удивить Вас способом прохождения с лучшим результатом. Так что запаситесь печеньками и вкусным напитком. Удачи!
BEST GAME EVER

I feel that three things must be stressed for those like myself who arrived late to the party:

1) Portal is a classic, and absolutely worth playing if you haven't done so yet. Even if puzzle games are not generally your cup of tea, this game takes a unique approach to the genre, exploiting many different creative facets of its relatively simple gameplay mechanics. But the highlight of this game, as I see it, is its extremely witty and often downright hilarious dialogue (or perhaps monologue would be a more appropriate word).

2) That said, if you are still uncertain about whether or not you will enjoy this game, I feel compelled to recommend that you wait until its on sale to make the purchase. My reason for this is that the full campaign is disappointingly short (my friend and I both beat the entire game in 3.5 hours)... about 2 hours into the game, the plot takes a twist of sorts, and suddenly gains significant momentum that almost gives the impression that the main crux of the game is finally starting. But no such luck... about an hour later, you realize you've beaten the game, which feels like it ends right after it truly begins. 

3) Replay value is low in my opinion. Recently I let my friend play through it on my computer while I watched, and I found that I remembered practically every solution right away. However, even merely sitting in the passenger seat as my friend traversed the angular corridors of Aperture Science Laboratories, I found myself thoroughly entertained by the clever writing... and, of course, my friend's confused frustration in all the same sections of the game that I struggled with.

Conclusion: Even if this isn't the type of game you would normally be interested in, I think most will quickly discover why this game has received such acclaim throughout the years. I think most gamers should not hesitate to add this game to their library... assuming the price is right ($9.99 for an old game that is *so* short might be hard to justify for some, but if you happen to find it on sale, waste no time in picking it up).

I enjoyed Portal and would recommend it. The game is a non-violent move-puzzle with a Half-Life feel to it. It appeals to me as a game tourist, because it moves along yet challenges. Each chamber has new concepts to understand and skills to acquire, and the game controls are basic. This game could be given to kids to test spatial IQ. The song at the end is very comical. I like that this game has an end, unlike some of the open-world games out there that require many trips back and forth across a map, retrieving crap and searching for whatnot - I didn't feel like I wasted a bunch of time on learning game minutia. Pick this game up on sale, as it is an older title, 'cause it's worth it.

This game is innovation and originality at it's best, and feels like nothing I've ever played before nor can I relate this game with another game. The puzzles are jam packed full of fun and figuring out how to finally complete that one level really does give you a sense of accomplishment. It's quite short but was great while it lasted and after completing the game you can test your skills on the bonus advanced and challenge maps which reuses the same levels but with added components to make the experience more challenging. Valve has once again made a great game and it only gets better for Portal from here on. ;)

玩完了奖励关卡就再也不想玩了。。说好的解密游戏怎么就考验起手速了QAQ

    特别是18关，百度才知道炮台的解法。。还有最开始第三个落脚点真的太不明显了，最后垂直平台跳得我恶心。
    
    不过，好在也就后面几个奖励关卡比较让我吐血，整个游戏流程很轻松愉快的，之后还玩了几个注释关卡听开发者谈细节设计也很有意思。挑战我是肯定不玩了，虽然有好几个成就与挑战相关。。

   如果我不是刚打过奖励关卡而是刚通流程的话，评测心情和内容肯定大不一样。。（我之前印象里还总以为玩过1代，但其实并没有）

Having been exposed to the hype surrounding this game for years, I have gone out of my way to avoid playing it. Now having played it, I can say that the game certainly lived up to the hype. 

The puzzles were interesting but not shoe-eating impossible. The humour was dry and witty (excellent in other words). The visual design was hauntingly elegant. Everything was there that needed to be there and it all came together beautifully. 

The length of the game was on the side of just enough. Any longer and I would have started to get a little bored and letting my mind wander as to the possibilities of a Portal Gun.

The only qualms i would have is the soundtrack started to get a little repetitive and the gold level challenges are nearly impossible.

But all in all i would say this game is worth everyones time.

This is one of the greatest puzzle games I have ever played.  I would highly recommend this to anyone who loves puzzles, but is tired of easy continuous and boring puzzles.  Not only does this game involve some of the most challenging and fun puzzles I've ever seen, it also has a rather engaging storyline as well.  The only problem I have with this game, is that I was able to beat it on my first playthrough in about 5 hours, which I was slightly disappointed at as I'm used to taking around 60 hours for a full playthrough of a Zelda game or the like, though I'm sure portal 2 has a lot to offer to extend the game for me.

Portal is an excellent first-person puzzle game that I recommend everyone to play. With its quirky story and hilarious manuscript, you will undoubtedly chuckle and giggle many times during this ~7 hour long game. Beside the main quest, there are some great challenges, such as time trials and an 'advanced mode', that will give you several more hours of fun.

Portal est un super jeux de réflexion, il vaut vraiment le coup pour son faible prix.
Le seul probleme est sa courte durée de vie (environ 4H).

[h1]¡¡Te regalan una p*ta pistola que hace portales!! ¿Qué más quieres?[/h1]

Pues eso, sin nigún tipo de introducción [u]te sueltan en un campo de pruebas[/u] en el que debes avanzar haciendo uso de una pistola de portales. A lo largo de las pruebas [u]te guiará la voz de GLaDOS[/u], la amable AI que se encarga de moverte por las cámaras y que velará por tu seguridad.

El juego funciona bien en mi birria de portátil, así que [u]los gráficos no son nada del otro mundo[/u], pero están muy bien. Las cámaras de pruebas están bien montadas y sólo he encontrado bugs gráficos una vez (seguramente porque mi procesador está a puntito de derretirse). Los [u]controles son simples[/u], no he probado compatibilidad con mando pero sin duda teclado+ratón es lo mejor, no he tenido problemas durante el juego. La música no abunda, pero cuando empieza le da carácter al juego, [u]buena banda sonora[/u], sí. En cuanto a [u]la historia... se queda un poco corta[/u]. Hay puzles difíciles y los mapas de desafío alargan un poco las horas de juego pero tampoco mucho más allá, me ha sabido a poco. El juego lo vale, [u]se puede pagar entero[/u] sin miedo a sentirse timado.

[b]En general es un juego de puzles y habiliad molón. Si lo compras recuerda: disfruta del pastel.[/b]
:D
Отличная игра !!!

Holy Buckets is this a fun game!

I love that you can use physics to your advantage by turning gravity (i.e. downward momentum) into forward momentum.  The intro puzzles where well crafted to teach you the skill to get through the next puzzles.  Then, after you've figured everything out, they ramp up the complexity.

I also like that there isn't one way to beat the level.  There is one way through "the maze", but how you acheive that is up to you.  Often they provide you with tools that may or may not help you, and it's up to you to decide if you want to use them.

The graphics are fun and clean.  The environment is easy to understand and extremely consistant - which it has to be if you're walking through a wall to drop through the ceiling.

Your computer host is funny as hell.  There is so much nuance in the comments and suggestions.  I makes me giggle.

Great job guys!  Five stars!  I'll play this for days and days

If you're easily scared (like myself) this game may give you the feeling you're bieng watched...which technically you are. But if your worried about it being scary it's not. You will have a great time playing this! 9/10 for me!
